text.text: Fukuivenator, a small theropod from the Kitadani Formation in Cretaceous Japan. It was small theropod that picked on small prey, but would've much preferred shrubbery with flat teeth. A early Therizinosauria that via convergent evolution looked like a dromaeosaur. First discovered and described in 2016, in 2021 it was determined to be a basal member of Therizinosauria.
Fukuivenator was 2.45 meters from nose to tail, being rather small and would've feared larger preditors.
